editorialNotes.tagline: Don't let the zombies stop you
Can you become king of the hill?

editorialNotes.standard: Get behind the wheel of the world’s fastest cars in this graphical powerhouse—and experience a singularly cool documentary-like career mode.

ios.subtitle: Race the golden era of rally

editorialNotes.tagline: It’s a golden age for rallying

editorialNotes.standard: This breakneck chapter in the Riptide GP series is so intense, it’s got us reaching for a life jacket. Or maybe several: Renegade’s solo campaign packs tons of water-racing events and sick tricks to master. (Split-screen local and eight-player online matches are our favorites.) However you play, stunning tracks like a gorgeous forest river deliver awesome arcade thrills. On Apple TV, it's our 2016 Game of the Year.
editorialNotes.short: Manage your speed and watch out for waves in this brilliant water-racing sequel.

editorialNotes.standard: Multiple camera angles, rally racing, demolition derbies—we’re impressed by the variety packed into this adrenaline-fueled racer.

Developer Jan Ilavsky came up with the idea for this gorgeous Apple Design Award winner after he’d broken his arm. He started on an infinite runner that could be played one-handed, and since he’s also colorblind, he added a gameplay element about changing between vibrant neon colors. Chameleon Run succeeds beautifully, balancing wicked speed with irresistible, just-one-more-try challenges.
editorialNotes.short: You'll need quick reactions in this intense polychromatic platformer.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.short: One team, one dream. But a massive number of tyre options.

editorialNotes.standard: Packing tons of great vehicles and multiple ways to play, Mini Motor Racing hits the sweet spot between frantic arcade driving and the depth of realistic racers. The look is cute yet richly detailed, with luscious lighting and environmental effects across a variety of tracks and terrains. Win cash to upgrade your ride in the lengthy career mode, or hit the quickplay and multiplayer circuits for a spin around the block. However you roll, flexible steering options let you drive with precision for a great time behind the wheel.

An absolutely blistering sensation of speed lies at the core of this intriguing mash-up of racing game and infinite runner. As you guide a futuristic ship toward the horizon by tapping either side of the screen to steer, you have to whip around obstacles and snare energy boosts to stay alive. Some sessions are over in seconds, some triumphantly stretch into minutes. Spare, modern graphics set the perfect mood as you inevitably become obsessed with zooming just a little bit farther on your next run.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
